course_title: Topics in Mathematics: Math. Foundations Data Science
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 35 / Seats Avail: 35Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Topic:  Mathematical Foundations of Data Science
The goal of this class is to provide the necessary mathematical foundations for modern data science.  Topics include numerical linear algebra, image compression, clustering, classification, regression, numerical methods for least-squares problems, large-scale numerical optimization, nonlinear regression, and unsupervised and supervised learning techniques.  The course introduces students to theory and methods for data science, and students get hands-on experience working on examples from a variety of applications.
Prerequisites: MATH 221 (Linear Algebra) and MATH 211 (Advanced Calculus) or MATH 210 (Advanced Calculus for Data Sciences), some experience with MATLAB, Python, or a similar package will be helpful. 
Please contact undergraduate coordinator Taylr Tuggle (taylr.annece.tuggle@emory.edu) to request permission.
course_description: Rotating topics in mathematics. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies. Pre and co requisites depend on the topic offered.
